info.headline: Flood Warning issued July 4 at 8:00PM CDT until July 5 at 1:37PM CDT by NWS Austin/San Antonio TX
info.description:
...The National Weather Service in Austin/San Antonio TX has issued a Flood Warning for the following rivers in Texas...
Sandy Creek Near Kingsland affecting Llano County.
* WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast.
* WHERE...Sandy Creek near Kingsland.
* WHEN...From late tonight to early tomorrow afternoon.
* IMPACTS...At 12.0 feet, Lowland flooding will threaten lowest boats at sandy harbor and sunrise beach at the lower end of sandy creek.
* ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 7:00 PM CDT Friday the stage was 6.7 feet. - Bankfull stage is 8.0 feet. - Forecast...The river will rise above flood stage to 12.3 feet just after midnight tonight. It will then fall below flood stage just after midnight tonight to 8.8 feet tomorrow evening. - Flood stage is 12.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 13.0 feet on 05/31/2016. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction:
Turn around, don't drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
To escape rising water, take the shortest path to higher ground.
Even 6 inches of fast-moving flood water can knock you off your feet and a depth of 2 feet will float your car. Never try to walk, swim, or drive through such swift water. If you come upon flood waters, stop, turn around and go another way.
Additional information is available at www.weather.gov.
The next statement will be issued Saturday afternoon by 145 PM CDT.

parameter.value: FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT FROM LATE TONIGHT TO EARLY TOMORROW AFTERNOON
